p: Toxicity: C. asiatica extract and asiaticoside were found to be well tolerated in experimental studies. Asiaticoside did not cause any toxicity up to 1 g/kg oral dose [ 69]. In acute toxicity study, C. asiatica extract up to 10 g/kg did not shown any sign of toxicity whereas in the subacute toxicity study, no toxicity was observed when the extract was administered at the doses of 10â€“1000 mg/kg. In the chronic toxicity study, doses up to 1200 mg/kg/day for six months did not result in significant toxicity in Wistar rats [ 70]. However, in one study, oral administration of 1000 mg/kg/day dried C. asiatica for 30 days caused hepatotoxicity in albino rats [ 71].
